alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 6:00PM EDT until June 11 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall impacting much of central and northern Chatham County, including parts of the Savannah Metro Area. As much as 1.5 inches of rain has fallen in a few spots over the past hour and an additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 730 PM. Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas is possible, - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, Hunter Army Airfield, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Windsor Forest, Downtown Savannah, Savannah International Airport, Midtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, Hutchinson Island, Godley Station, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Bloomingdale, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff and Burroughs.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
